Posts.Content: nursing_51 wrote: path report showed benign tissue with changes , cystic dilation ,columnar cell change and hyperplasia without atypia, microcalcifications with benign duct profiles.  MD wants a repeat biopsy in 3 months and said to watch lump close for any changes. Should i relax and say ok its benign or worry over him wanting another biopsy so soon. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: benign results vs repeat biopsy nursing_51 nursing_51

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2010 08:12PM - edited Nov 17, 2010 08:32PM by nursing_51 Saw general surgeon, who i know does most breast surgeries in this area, and has been in practice 20+ years.  He was surprised at biopsy results since mammo was negative for any type of mass, yet ultrasound showed solid mass, i saw both and mass was there, about size of lima bean. Some high risk items in family history:  father has had renal cell, colon and prostrate cancer.  Maternal great aunt and her daughter both had bi-lateral mass due to breast cancer.  My first menses was at age 9 and i smoked for 24 years.  I talked with onocologist about results and he seemed to agree with follow-up biopsy.  Area of concern is at lower base of aerola and slightly up behind nipple.
Posts.Title: benign results vs repeat biopsy nursing_51 nursing_51
